title: Runes Honestly Need to be a Little Cheaper
body:
Let's face it Riot, we know you'd rather have us spend our IP on runes and buy RP for champs, but that just isn't a practical outlook on League for most (90%+) of players. (that's the REAL reason you can't buy runes with RP) If the price of T3 runes was reduced to be more in line with the stats they provide and their T1 and T2 counterparts (10x more for +2 armor) then people might even be willing to pay the unreasonable price you set for rune pages. Think of it like this, runes are the stats, pages let you diversify. Hindering someone because they don't the extra IP to buy the runes they want to play a champ is honestly a little bit mean. And having to decide no whether to buy and fill one more page or buying 2 or 3 6300 IP champions is outrageous.

TL;DR :  Even like a 50% reduction in rune prices would put runes on an affordable scale, and more players would be on even ground because they can actually AFFORD to fill their rune pages.

EDIT: Someone mentioned what would probably be another alternative that might make Riot happier (aka we'd still spend a lot of IP on Runes instead of champs). Lazergamer suggested that runes be parts of the rewards system, where after X number of games you could unlock a free mark, then seal, than glyph, etc. I'm not asking for a shortcut to be a "good player". I just don't like the idea of paying 20K+ IP to fill a rune page that helps 2-3 of my champions.

People would complain, sure I think runes should be a little cheaper, hell 100 IP cheaper would be nice but im fine grinding away to make a full crit page for the hell of it, thats fun as all hell especially when I go tank garen but have 25% crit chance.  Wanna see skill, look at people who think more about late game then early game, not saying im skilled at all, but I take scaling ad runes (ik ik T_T ima scrub but i like em :P they are for my top laners mainly though)  on all my ad's top mid support adc, it dont matter to me.  Others though take a mixture of ad scaling and flats or all flats. its personal preference but it gives everyone an edge in their own way.  hell if you have a high sustain adc why take flats when you could just take all scaling?  again all personal preference.


TLDR:  Don't remove runes! maybe make em a bit cheaper but its fun grinding up IP when you're just fucking around with friends in game and notice hours later you accumulated 2k IP.  its fun and lets keep it that way :D

You aren't supposed to be on even ground as soon as you hit level 30.  You're asking for everything to be made easier because you can't be bothered to put in the time to build your rune pages like every other player.

Are you actually a proponent for keeping runes as are? I don't get it.

It's a terrible wall that confines metagaming, game health, and player accessibility. All of which are aspects of negative design philosophy.

Runes can add meaningful choice and some minor depth to the game but they have to be accessible in the first place.

A true competitive player doesn't whine about evening the playing field. They want the field even, and they want to prove themselves on it. I want to face opponents that are equipped to play the game, and win or lose based on outplaying them, not due to out grinding them or having been around long enough to accumulate everything.

A skill gate is one thing, a grind gate is bullshit.

Runescape is a grind, this is just part of the game, what you are asking for is a shortcut.  Runes are fine as is,  by the time someone has filled out a page or two of runes they have hopefully learned how to play a few champions.  You aren't supposed to skip normals and jump straight into ranked matches.

If you weren't supposed to do it, the game simply wouldn't allow you to. Runes would be a gated requirement. That's a fallacious argument based in assumption and not reality.

Whether or not they're truly prepared is already dealt with in how they will be placed on the ladder.

I don't want a shortcut. I already have everything I need. I want a level playing field and accessibility for new blood for better long-term game health in an aging game.

I posted elsewhere in this thread about how much of a grind runes actually are. If you don't think it's grindy you're in denial. It's right up there with Korean MMO levels of inflated game time for progress, except it's for a core game mechanic necessary to success that the game never even bothers to teach you about.

If we paid fees to play in gaming cafes grind style makes sense from a business angle. Outside of that metric, it's fairly pointless and doesn't add depth to a game.

The argument is frequently that it incentivizes buying champions with cash and saving IP for runes. This is logical as an isolated point. With competition in the marketplace though it's not as straightforward. Instead of being a push towards spending money on actual content, it's become just a wall for access to the game that takes dozens of hours upon hours to overcome.

But the game does bare the way to ranked, does it not? If it didn't then at lvl 1 you would be able to play ranked. Am I not correct?  Runes help you learn as a player, you make a mistake building a rune page? well you learned for the next time and can re-use some of those runes. RUNE COMBINER I WANT YOU BACK!
I'm not sure how you're reading things beyond exactly what I've written.

I'm not sure how ***you are*** not understanding what I have written. Here I will spell it out.

Ranked is bared by needing to grind to lvl 30.   

Throughout this grind you need to learn about masteries, runes, champions, roles and all that jazz.  

Then you have to learn to optimize, work with a team and so forth. 

 In this grind to level 30 you should have accumulated approximately, 30625.69 IP, (decimals ARE accounted for in the addition to IP after matches, that is why you can gain  a +/- 1 IP between matches)  that is the average amount of IP between matches [Shown here, might be outdated](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=2287799) .  

This is excluding wins of the day of course. So lets see here,  most people will have bought a few champions by now for this role or that role, by the time I hit thirty I had about 33 champions, with a full AD rune page, a very...screwy ad page.0
 by this time I knew I wanted Scaling ad, health, mr, attack speed and move speed because I mained Irelia (season 3 -4 oh how I loved thee).  So I had a funky rune page till I combined runes I disliked, grinded for the runes I needed and input them.  

That's my point right there. Being forced to have to learn from past mistakes made me a smarter player on how to build (IK IK SCALING AD BUT I LIKE IT OKAY!)  my rune pages.  That is as much of an integral part of League as  getting to level 30 is.

I understand what you said, it was just outside the context of the discussion that was occurring. I never claimed rank wasn't gated by level. The poster I responded too claimed that you're not supposed to just jump into ranked when you hit 30. While this is good advise it's not an actual limitation.

Learning about runes would be great if the game even bothered to teach players about them. Or really *any* of the meta-level mechanics that are happening within the game. Or if it didn't drop IP sink traps in the form of lesser runes. (That's been alleviated to a degree) The fact that there are just outright bad runes for new players to stumble into is not something that should be celebrated as a learning curve but rather denounced as poor design and balance. Good design would mitigate as much end user error as possible.

Thanks for the link, it lines up pretty well with my own numbers elsewhere in this thread.

I'm not asking for free runes. I want to see the grind wall reduced by roughly 30-40% in cost and I want to see real balancing done. The whole system as it stands is a mess that doesn't belong in a game that's grown as successfully as this one has. Particularly because it's such core game mechanic.

The burden of knowledge in this game is massive. Riot's clarity goals need to extend outside of just the action during gameplay, for the sake of player accessibility.

I did the grind for my runes and I even bought all 20 pages to become a well equipped player. I think the grind is necessary like Errastas said, the game is not about skipping normals to jump into ranked.
heck even a 25% reduction be great. Making a 2k ip rune down to 1500, means i have to win 5 games less for 1 dam rune...
The cost of tier 3 runes is too damn high!
haha I need runepage to be cheaper too

Here we go with this again........"People who put less time and effort into the game are at a disadvantage"..............Yeah, pretty much...............
Based on the complaints we always hear in these threads the ppl that are making them don't play LoL seriously enough to even need more than 2 rune pages(maybe 3) because if you did you wouldn't be whining about rune cost......

I wish one of you would just cut the crap and just admit that you want more free stuff, its not enough that the entire game is free and the only thing that cost money are cosmetic features. Why dont we just start with level 30 accounts while were at it and hey start games with an extra 2k gold. Oh oh I got it, how about as soon as the game loads in you are already at the victory screen looking at a destroyed Nexus? 

Why put in at time or effort into the game at all, in fact why don't you just not play league and tell ppl you already won worlds?

It costs 8610 IP to build a standard AD rune page. Given a 50% win rate it means a player makes roughly 125 IP per hour spent playing. That means it takes just shy of 69 hours of game play to build this typical page, that you already have a free runepage for to start.

Now daily win is a factor, but the more games you play per day the less of an impact it actually has on the amount you will have to grind. Let's put it over a 3 week period. In which you get 3150 IP from daily win. It still costs 5460 more IP for the runes. This still equates to an average of nearly 44 hours of pure gameplay. Just to build something you *need* to have. 44 hours into any game I should definitely have access to the most basic necessities for being able to play the game.

All that just for 1 rune page. Not even for champions which are the real meat of LoL content. When you need to buy additional rune pages for alternative rune set ups and specific runes the grind gets even worse. Even you if offered the argument of buying champions for RP, that's still a ridiculous grind period to get your entry level runes set up.

Contextually your commentary is absurd. Anyone who uses the time argument against proposed rune accessibility changes has got to be either entirely selfish, or ignorant, having not analyzed what they're really saying.

The game is not an MMORPG, and doesn't need this tacked on progression grind. It's a competitive player vs player game and the less even the field is the worse it is for the nature of what the game is supposed to be.

you dont *need *runes though...go make a smurf account, pick a champ youre amazing at, then get your way to thirty and start ranked their. see what happens. its amazing what will happen if the algorithm picks up you aint using runes

People also call you out for having the wrong runes, which sucks. "Sorry I didn't have the 20000 Ip needed to have the right rune page. I'll go play for a year and come back to you."

It does slow down the process, but as a long time league player I have made many smurfs and highly recommend you save IP to lvl 20/30 and than you can buy ap and ad standard tier 3 runes. Champions are hard to come by and even using IP to buy them would take a lot of hours to get even a few champions for regular IP price

I've come to the conclusion that they're just stalling this out. Which I don't understand. They're at a crux point in the age of their game, where the accessibility wall needs to come down as much as possible.

I also get the sinking feeling their alternative might end up being to buff IP boosts instead (which are currently a terrible value trap) where they can actually cash in off the community instead of helping it directly.

You guys want everything for free rofl....the game being free on its own is not enough I guess...Riot is offering you their game FOR FREE as your personal entertainment almost every day for almost 5 years now and yet you guys still want more.

See what I did there? I used your same argument against you and gave plenty of examples of how easy it actually is to earp IP.

How is that in any way my argument? I was saying that your post had nothing to do with the actual price of runes and instead tried to use "This game is free" to try and deflect any criticism of a certain system within the game.

As for the things you mentioned, yes, that is true, but it is also true that the price of runes is much higher than the stats they give compared to T1/T2 runes. (I really don't think T1 and T2 runes should even exist, but thats a separate argument entirely)

And I HAVE gotten the runes I need the same way everyone else bloody does, that doesn't change the situation of them being a serious pain in the ass to get sometimes, notably some quints cost upwards of 2000 IP and you have to blow a 6300 champions worth of IP just to get *3* of those runes.

While they might not be making Runes cheaper, they're giving us party rewards for queueing with friends.  That was pretty much like buying an IP boost, I got so much IP.  They also give us sales and stuff throughout the year.  Runes are more important than Champions, I think they're fine the way they are.
